result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse Gillam was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jesse Gillam is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jesse Gillam was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
Payment Plan: $50.00/month commencing on September 1, 2017

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse Gillam

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Jesse Gillam in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this is a motion to terminate the DPA based on the defendant tested positive.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant wants to waive his right to an Attorney and proceed.    Court finds waiver of attorney made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.
Defendant agrees.  

BY THE COURT:  Motion granted; DPA will be terminated. Court finds the defendant guilty of Ct. 1 and the conviction will be entered as of today's date.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.

BY THE COURT:  Pay $100 + costs = $473.50
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on September 1, 2017
Motion hearing on August 17, 2017 at 09:45 am.
Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of: 12 months

Defendant Jesse Gillam in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16TR1987 tracking:
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed. 16TR1987 to be dismissed.    Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of:  12 months with condtions on Ct. 1.  
Defendant agrees.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant waives their right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a Guilty plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea; approves and signst the 12 month DPA with conditions on Ct. 1.  
Count 2 along with 16TR1987 to be dismissed.

Pre-trial conference on December 27, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Return date on January 18, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Jesse Gillam in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that last time in court the defendant indicated that he wanted to get an Attorney.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant does not want to get an Attorney and would like to meet with the District Attorney.
Court questions the defendant.      Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Return and Pre-Trial
bond continued  Return date scheduled for January 18, 2017 at 03:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 27, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Return date on December 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Jesse Gillam in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16TR1987 tracking:
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
 Court confirms the defendant's address.  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant wants to get an Attorney.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return  Return date scheduled for December 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
